snippet: The plunging value of government bonds has hurt tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans, and a restructuring of the debt could heap more hardship on them.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans who invested in commonwealth's  government bonds are hardest hit by island's debt crisis and default; group of investors has filed class-action suit with Financial Industry Regulatory Authority against Swiss Bank UBS, saying brokers, who were paid by Puerto Rican government to sell the bonds, misled them about riskiness of investment.
lead_paragraph: The plunging value of government bonds has hurt tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans, and a restructuring of the debt could heap more hardship on them.

headline.main: Pain of Puerto Rico’s Debt Crisis Is Weighing on the Little Guy, Too
headline.print_headline: Pain of Puerto Rico’s Debt Crisis Is Weighing on the Little Guy, Too
